products.name: TruBridge EHR
products.description: Comprehensive hospital information system for inpatient and ambulatory care, with integrated ancillary systems (LIS, RIS, pharmacy), enterprise modules (financials, HR, materials management), and home health. Designed for rural and community hospitals.
products.notes: Integrated LIS, RIS, and pharmacy modules make this a comprehensive HIS. Includes ERP functionality (financials, HR, payroll, materials management). Home health modules for hospital-affiliated agencies. InstantPHR is the associated patient portal (separate certification). Unclear if billing/claims are part of EHR or handled by separate RCM services.

products.name: TruBridge Provider EHR
products.description: Ambulatory-focused EHR with mobile rounding, practice management, and clinical documentation for outpatient clinics and physician practices. Supports inpatient, outpatient, and emergency care settings. Designed for providers who need efficient documentation and mobile access.
products.notes: Ambulatory-focused variant of TruBridge EHR. Includes practice management (scheduling, billing charges). Mobile access emphasized. Lighter footprint than full TruBridge EHR (no LIS/RIS/pharmacy/home health modules listed). Not certified for cancer registry reporting (f)(3), suggesting not used in oncology specialty settings.

notes: TruBridge also has two other certified products (CHBase™ and InstantPHR®) not included in the CHPL IDs for this research, but relevant to the ecosystem: CHBase is an interoperability/data exchange platform; InstantPHR is a patient portal that works with TruBridge EHR, Meditech, and athenaOne. TruBridge offers extensive RCM outsourcing services—it is unclear whether billing/claims data is stored in the certified EHR or in separate RCM systems. Primary market is rural and community hospitals with 45+ years of experience in this segment.
